intro: Davya paniculata, commonly known as the clustered davya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Davya paniculata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cool, high-altitude environments.
